intro: Guatteria microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface. The flowers are small and greenish-white, and the fruit is a drupe that matures to a dark purple color.
